_meanings:
{@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva, the second of 

the three syllables in {#om#}; see {#a#}.

{@--1@} As a particle used 
expletively; {#u umeSaH#} <ls>Sk.</ls>

{@--2@} An 
interjection of:-- ({%a%}) calling; {#u meti mAtrA#} 

{#tapaso nizidDA paScAdumAKyAM sumuKI jagAma#}
<ls>Ku. 1. 26</ls>; ({%b%}) anger; ({%c%}) 
compassion; ({%d%}) command; ({%e%}) acceptance; ({%f%})
interrogation; or ({%g%}) used merely as an
expletive. In the Veda used as an
enclitic copula implying restriction 

and emphasis (and, but, on the
other hand, now, I ask &c.);
in classical literature used 
chiefly with {#aTa#} ({#aTo#}), {#na#} ({#no#}) and
{#kim#} ({#kimu#}); see these words. {#u-u#}
or {#uta#} on the one hand-on the other
hand, partly-partly.
